lines.text: Chester, I give you my SOLEMN word. THIS time it's not dangerous.
Not dangerous?
No.

That's what 'cha said when you shot me out of a cannon, when you dropped me in a tank with an octopus, when you had me wrestle a gorilla. It's not dangerous! I'm not goin'. I'm through. I've had it. So forget it, *Charly*!

[hands Chester a hand mirror]
Who's that?

[seeing his reflection]
I don't know, but gimme a stick and I'll kill it.
I'll never look at another banana split.
Why do you suppose they're sending *us* up?
They wanna find out if it's gonna be safe for the apes.
Oh.

[espying Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra]
The Italians have landed!
That's the grape and the twig, isn't is?
Yeah, and they got the bar open.
Let's break it up.
Those tourists.

In that rocket, we're about to send two animals around the moon; and, if we succeed, we shall next send two men. And from the moon, that point of impenetrable power, I shall go before the United Nations and demand that they accede to our total and absolute control.

[to Harry]
I think he rolls his own.
An hour ago she flipped over me. I don't dig it.
Well, that's understandable. An impressionable young thing falls for an elderly fellow. She probably thought you were a father figure.
Father figure?
Yes, then she took another look and found out you had your father's figure.
I'll deal with humanity as I please and I'll do with humanity as I choose and I'll do it from the moon with my radio lunar bombs.
There must be some sensible solution to this problem.
Well, of course there is. Two fellas, one girl. Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, you come to my house.
Yeah. Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, my house.
What about Sunday?
Everbody rests.
No, I can see the tears forming in your wallet.
Well, don't get sore at me. It's just a plot point.
Don't I always get you the best medical attention available?
Yeah, like that doctor you got me in Bombay last month.
How was I going to know he was an elephant doctor?
You should have known by the size of his thermometer.
Yes, was a bit large.
When he shook it, I was still on it.
Happy landings, buster!
I don't know what you're so happy about. You're not mentioned in my will.

[examining Chester]
Ugh!
What is it, Doctor?
Terrible heartburn. Oh, dear, put too much curry in my corn flakes, you understand.
[as the neurologist plays his flute during Chester's examination, a cobra rises from its basket]

Oh, nothing to worry about. If he should give you a nip, it's very simple. All you do is to get hold of your bowie knife like this, make a cut on here, suck out the poison and spit it away. Very simple.
Yeah, but what if he bites me in a place I can't reach?
That is when you find out who your real friends are.

[while agent Diane mistakenly thinks she's made her secret contact with a microfilm photographer, Chester, thinking himself a chick magnet, simply believes he's caught the eye of a beautiful, romantic woman]

[whispers]
Do you think we're being watched?

[noticing Harry staring at them from the bar]
Definitely.
Oh, then we'll have to hurry.
Have we got time?
If you work fast.
I'll do my best.
Good. Now, I've got the room ready at the hotel.
Good.
I've made all the arrangements.
Fine.
The shades are all drawn.
Very sensible.
And we can lock the door from the inside.
Oh, good. I'd hate to get a crowd until I get the hang of it.

[Agent Diane continues to mistakenly think she's made her secret contact with a microfilm photographer while Chester, thinking himself a chick magnet, still believes he's caught the eye of a beautiful, romantic woman]
Are you sure you've done this sort of thing before?

[suffering from amnesia]
Well, I MUST have. When do we start?
Right now.

[suddenly shouting]
Darling, it's so wonderful to see you again.
[She slips him an envelop as she kisses him]

[whispering]
You've got it.

[ego stroked and oblivious to the envelop]
I know it.
Don't lose it.
Don't worry.
I'll see you at the hotel.
Pull the shades and lock the door.
One final thing.
Yes?
In case I'm late, you go ahead without me.
You got a mind like a sponge.
Yeah, don't get any ideas about squeezing it, either.
Are you sure you're not pulling my leg?
Business first, fun and games later, mm?

[cracks open a fortune cookie and reads]
"You are under grave suspicion. Your partner suspects you of dishonesty."

[passing it to Harry]
Here, it's for you.

[gazing out an airplane window]
There she lies, Chester - Hong Kong.
Yeah, what a monument to fried rice.
Hey, we're UNDER water! That's the ocean!
So?
So? We spring a little leak, we'll drown.
Well, you don't have to worry. You got a built-in snorkel.

[seeing a shark outside the porthole]
Looks like he just ate Lloyd Bridges.
Don't worry. They don't eat people.
How about actors.
We're safe.
Mr. Babcock, if you leave now, you'll be running out on your fellow man.
That still leaves my fellow women.
Chester, search your secret soul. Ask your patriotic conscience what to do.
I already did.
What'd it say?
"Yankee, go home."
My nose bleeds when I put my carpet slippers on.
At least you can die like heroes.
Nah, but we're to old to die.
I could love you, body and soul.
They're available, in that order.
Who do you think they'll be shooting at - you or the schnook with the I.B.M. machine up his univac?
Trust me and you'll come to no harm.
Trust me and I make no promises.
How do we get out of here?
The submarine. I can handle it.
I know. I read the script.
Those guys mean business. They're killers, murders.
Besides that, they're unfriendly.
